title: otrkid1970
author: otrkid1970
content: Quick question for anyone that can answer.When you post on this site and delete the post is there a copy stored or is it forever gone? Also if it is stored can be accessed my mods or theymos?The reason i ask is i'm looking for information from one of my past deleted posts.ThanksEdit: I was kind of vague in my question. I mean a post that I deleted not a mod for spam or anything.

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: otrkid1970 on November 02, 2022, 08:12:04 PMWhen you post on this site and delete the post is there a copy stored or is it forever gone? Also if it is stored can be accessed my mods or theymos?As far as I know the mods move the topic to trashcan. As a result we can not see the post anymore but they can.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Yeah everyone can still see your posts even if they got deleted. Two most popular ways to see deleted (yours and everyone else's) posts are via https://ninjastic.space/ and https://loyce.club/archive/posts/

comments.author: otrkid1970
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on November 02, 2022, 08:15:47 PMYeah everyone can still see your posts even if they got deleted. Two most popular ways to see deleted (yours and everyone else's) posts are via https://ninjastic.space/ and https://loyce.club/archive/posts/ That first website looks promising the second not so much.Thanks for the info

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: otrkid1970 on November 02, 2022, 08:19:22 PMThat first website looks promising the second not so much.First one is more convenient (and is the one I use most of the time as it has some very useful features) but you should be able to find what you are looking with either of those.Quote from: otrkid1970 on November 02, 2022, 08:19:22 PMThanks for the infoNp, cheers.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: Rikafip pointed you to the right source. If a post gets deleted or edited you could always find an archived version of it as long as it has been scraped.For example, I would think at quickest a cron job would run every minute which means if a post was made and deleted after a scrape already took place but before the next scrape was due (within 59 seconds), it will not be archived.If cron jobs are not being used and some other method is being used for crawling then it would depend on the custom coding but I would highly doubt if in this scenario anything other than cron jobs are being used to scrape.Quote from: otrkid1970 on November 02, 2022, 08:19:22 PMQuote from: Rikafip on November 02, 2022, 08:15:47 PMYeah everyone can still see your posts even if they got deleted. Two most popular ways to see deleted (yours and everyone else's) posts are via https://ninjastic.space/ and https://loyce.club/archive/posts/ That first website looks promising the second not so much.Thanks for the info

comments.author: suchmoon
comments.body: Quote from: JollyGood on November 02, 2022, 09:06:34 PMFor example, I would think at quickest a cron job would run every minute which means if a post was made and deleted after a scrape already took place but before the next scrape was due (within 59 seconds), it will not be archived.You wouldn't start a new cronjob for every scrape, and even if you did - there are ways to start them more often than once a minute (e.g. multiple jobs with different sleep intervals at the beginning). Anyway, the point is that scrapers can catch new posts within seconds.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: OP, besides these 3rd party archives that Rikafip mentioned, you can find some of your posts (even deleted ones) inside your drafts page.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=draftsQuoteDrafts are saved whenever you preview or post a topic, post, or PM. Up to 100 drafts are kept. Drafts are deleted after 7 days.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: otrkid1970 on November 02, 2022, 08:12:04 PMWhen you post on this site and delete the post is there a copy stored or is it forever gone? Also if it is stored can be accessed my mods or theymos?Forum admins and moderators have access to deleted posts and topics but there are some more detailed information for you. Those things won't be stored forever with different thresholds for live database, archive database and offline backups.Quote from: theymos on July 06, 2021, 01:49:49 PMDeleted posts are at first just hidden from public view. To steal the ID from such a post, the deleted post is given a new ID. The deleted spam post in this case now has ID 57394364.After about a year, deleted posts are moved off of the live database and into an archive database, and no longer occupy their original message ID in the live database. After about another year, deleted posts are deleted from the archive database as well, though they will probably still exist in offline backups.QuoteThe reason i ask is i'm looking for information from one of my past deleted posts.You can find your deleted post if it belongs to your last 100 posts and it is not more than 7 days old. After each 7 days, posts in draft page will be deleted automatically.Here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=draftsDraft (announcement from theymos)

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Here are some information about your privacy https://bitcointalk.org/privacy.phpQuoteDeleted posts and trust ratings, as well as their edit histories   Kept on the live server for a couple of years; then probably kept indefinitely in backups   Don't publicly post things that you might not want to exist foreveryour posts will Kept on the live server for a couple of years Your post exists and will be around for a few years but I don't know if the manager will share the data with you.
